H0.text: Erosion is the force that causes a soccer ball to fall to the ground after it has been kicked up in the air.

H1.text: Friction is the force that causes a soccer ball to fall to the ground after it has been kicked up in the air.

H2.text: Gravity causes a soccer ball to fall to the ground after it has been kicked up in the air.

H3.text: Magnetism is the force that causes a soccer ball to fall to the ground after it has been kicked up in the air.

A4.text: Gravity is the law that every object with mass attracts every other object in the universe in proportion to each mass and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

A5.text: Galileo postulated that air resistance is the reason that objects with a low density and high surface area fall more slowly in an atmosphere.
